text: if you're looking for a really easy
treat to make you can't get much easier
than this chocolate oatmeal peanut
butter bar it's no bake which is
fantastic and super delicious I have in
this bowl nine ounces of ground
chocolate wafer is like a Nabisco
chocolate wafer to that add one and a
half cups of rolled oats not the
quick-cooking kind and one and a quarter
cups of confectioner's sugar this is all
going to combine together with some
butter and peanut butter to make the
first layer of this really decadent
cookie dough by quarter teaspoon of
kosher salt
you can mix that together just briefly
and then in this pot I have a stick plus
two tablespoons of unsalted butter you
want to get that melted and in this bowl
I have a cup of crunchy peanut butter
and three-quarters of a cup of smooth
peanut butter when your butter is melted
you can whisk both of the peanut butters
into the butter mixture so it melts down
see what you're doing is making pretty
much the glue that's gonna hold this
cookie base together once everything is
fully melted you just pour the whole
thing into your cookie mixture and
scrape make sure that you get all of it
not gonna lie you guys I'm getting
pretty excited to try these mature
everything is moistened by the peanut
butter butter mixture and then get it
into a 9 by 13 inch pan this pan has
been sprayed with vegetable spray and
then lined with parchment sprayed again
then you want to press it evenly into
the bottom making a nice firm crust you
can use the bottom of a measuring cup
I've also sprayed this with vegetable
spray because that keeps it from
sticking makes it very nice for
something like this that's sticky you
don't always need to do that but in
like this where there's all this sugar
and peanut butter and it's very sticky
it's helpful if you're finding that it's
still sticking or sticking again you can
always respray the bottom of the egg cup
works really nicely though and then all
you need to do really is get this chill
before you move on the next step which
is coating it in chocolate so get this
into the refrigerator just until it's
set at least 30 minutes but you know you
can do this after it's refrigerated nice
and cold you're gonna want to coat it in
chocolate this is ten ounces of
semi-sweet chocolate that's melted you
can do it in the microwave you can melt
it however you want it'll probably stop
very quickly because your mixture is
cold so spread it out nice and evenly
these small offset spatulas are great
for getting into every little crevice
that's it this just has to set that
should only take like 10 minutes so you
can leave it in the refrigerator again
up to overnight this semi-sweet
chocolate is set and then the last step
is to drizzle some more smooth peanut
butter about three tablespoons over the
melted chocolate this gives a visual
indicator of what's inside what treats
are to come and then this is milk
chocolate so a little bit of a
contrasting color a little bit sweeter
than the bittersweet and then this just
needs to set in the fridge for a few
more minutes and then you can cut it up
into delicious and indulgent bites they
really just require some time not very
much effort at all it's helpful if you
have some warm water to cut nice clean
cuts you can dip your knife in the water
and then wipe it dry and then cut them
into whatever size you like I'm going to
cut into relatively small squares
because I find them quite rich and
delicious and they like to savor them in
small pieces
there you go look at that
you have the oat chocolate cookie layer
the chocolate layer and then a little
drizzle of extra peanut butter on top
just for a good measure I think you guys
are really going to love this one
super easy delicious treat
